title: Rek'Sai's Ultimate is underwhelming for such a great champ
body:
Rek'Sai seems like such a great champion in practice, with the unique tunnel/burrow mechanic and her scary ultimate.

Except her ultimate isn't scary. At all.

The problem is that you have to target a tunnel to go anywhere. This becomes a problem when you have played more than one game with Rek'Sai. How are you supposed to initiate or gank with this ultimate at all? The enemy knows exactly where your tunnels are if your tunnels are in any position that could be used for a gank, and can step on them without any harm. What are you going to do, ult on them when they step on the tunnel? Good joke, your ultimate has a 1.5 second cast time that tells any enemy that you are heading towards them so they can retreat before you even start heading towards them. They have slow reaction times? Don't worry, they will usually have a movement ability that will completely negate your ultimate.

The only use for Rek'Sai I could find is travelling to Dragon/Baron (depending on what side you are so you can set your tunnel safely behind) to be able to contest easily or having the ability to teleport to top/mid/bot entrance quickly. Tunnels in the jungle are worthless (in the context of the ultimate) because they give no vision even when the enemy is standing on them so you can't quickly teleport to an invader.

Riot, what was your vision for this ultimate? I think the mechanics of it should be adjusted a little (either give Tunnels an invulnerability period of say, 2 minutes or maybe give Rek'Sai an invisibility period of 2 seconds after teleporting to a tunnel to give her time to position to Unburrow on an unsuspecting enemy. She's underground!).

Thanks!

replies.body:
With Rek'Sai we deliberately did something a bit different with her ultimate. Given she's a form swapper, with more than the usual 4 skills, she already had access to a pretty large set of tools to use in combat and didn't need another. As a result we opted to go for a more strategic, less mid combat ult. Something that's used to get around the map, in preparation for combat/objectives/counter jungling/split pushing etc, rather than to put you into a great position to fight almost immediately (like TF, Panth, Nocturne can do for example).

It's not as powerful as many other ults in the game overall either and that's also deliberate for a couple of reasons. Having more spells than average means each individual spell's going to have to be weaker than average for the sake of balance and we wanted to put a lot of power into the defining, most distinctive parts, of Rek'Sai's kit, her Tremor Sense and Tunnels.

It can definitely be pretty tough getting, and keeping, a sufficient tunnel network to ult well, particularly as your enemies get better at stomping her tunnels quickly in all the 'best' places. Figuring out where to put them, when, whether to ward around them, which enemies to track etc are some of the key skills we expect to see dedicated Rek'Sai  players get really good at though. That's something that's pretty exciting to us since those aren't skills that other champions test in particularly similar ways.

I'm personally very excited about this and will be mega disappointed if she gets the Shen treatment. It's no fun to have a main permabanned and then nerfed into obscurity. I totally understand your reasoning for her ultimate. She does have access to more skills but they really are not that powerful. tremor sense is great but to call it accurate in the way it tracks movement is pretty exaggerated. Champion movement tracking is so inaccurate as the game progresses,  especially on faster champions. it is fine with slower moving champs and monsters like the scuttle crab as they pulse more frequently, but faster moving champs pulse so infrequently that it is deceiving.

If prey seeker actually did halfway decent damage then I could understand this disparity, but it doesn't. If she fully revealed champions she hit with prey seeker it might make sense, but she doesn't. if she had a little better vision range while burrowed it might make sense, but she only sees in her immediate proximity.

Then there are the tunnels. Sure, you can have 8 out at a time, but the instant the enemy team sees one it is permanently revealed on their minimap. They might last 10 minutes, but they are destroyed in a second if they stand on it...? I want to elaborate on this point a little more. I have never heard of a tunnel collapsing from someone standing at its entrance and just looking at it... it makes no sense. If the idea is that they are standing on top of the tunnel to force it to crumble wouldnt they end up getting trapped as it collapsed? that would be kind of a cool tradeoff actually for destroying a tunnel, it rooted you for a little bit (like .75-1 second) so there was actually a decision to be made when destroying it. It would also make an interesting mechanic in team fights in that if rek'sai tunneled into the middle of a fight and someone sat to long on the tunnel exit/entrance they get rooted for a moment as consequence. Then there is the fact that they give 5 gold for destroying them, "hey there, good job standing still in that spot for a second, here is 5 gold"... really? I had given this feedback on the PBE forum as well, there NEEDS to be a real tradeoff when it comes to destroying tunnels. Making someone stand in a spot for 3 seconds, root them when it collapses, something. I know why channeling to destroy them isn't an option, I get that, but just giving free gold to the enemy team for no time investment is just BS.

Then there is Burrow and Unburrow. I love this ability and its concept... except for the fact that unburrowing on a target a second time before the 10 seconds for the next knock up is ready deals no damage. She already has a limited number of damage sources outside of auto attacking, was it really necessary to add this limitation as well?

I like Rek'sai, I really do, but some of the decisions that were made feel poorly thought out... I don't mean to step on anyone's toes but it really feels that way.

I think her ult is pretty interesting and different, which i like. It will help her get to teamfights easier and we will also have to consider, where to place a tunnel. I think it's really awesome how she can just travel across the map under ground :)

It's up to the player to put her tunnels in places that they aren't likely to be found or stepped on, and to roam around continuously putting more in as she goes. Use it to get around your own jungle, or your opponent's after taking their outer turrets, and you'll always have tunnels available somewhere. They last for quite a long time and I honestly found many of my tunnels, even in the enemy's jungle, were timing out before they got stepped on more often than not.

You aren't supposed to be ulting directly into teamfights, you're supposed to be ulting near to one so you can pick the best entry point into it. Try not to use it as a combat tool like other ults, instead use it for what it's meant for: utility. 

For instance at one point last night I pushed bot inhib, backed up a bit, and as three enemies came barreling towards me I ulted to a tunnel I had near their top lane and proceeded to push down that inhib as well. By the time they ran up to stop me I dug underneath a wall and made a clean getaway.

From what I've gathered so far, playing with Rek'Sai is about thinking outside of the box. She's different, and should be approached differently.

Ultimate needs to give homeguard movement speed
and have a reasonable cooldown
I use it for map control, as she is not much of a ganker. I will use it to be in the places I need to be, even if it's ulting to Baron/Dragon/even a large creep wave I can push.

And I'll add, the threat of your ulti global presence, force the enemy team to make a lot of decision about if destroy known tunnels to prevent rek'sai to move around like crazy or go straight to take objectives, and if the enemy do a wrong decision, they can nullify the advantage they can get upon a win fight, or open up for further opporutiniy(because if one champ decide to go away from his mates and destroy a tunnel, this open up an opportunity to force an engage with a numerical advantage in a fight)

It's painful to play against a Rek'Sai if your team sucks as decision making and lack the ability to properly act and react to the various situations and threats Rek'Sai kit can create with tunnel mobility, burrow/unburrow, jugling and counterjungling, dueling abilities, etc...

People forget to account for the big passive AS boost that Rek'Sai recevie passively on her ulti(especially at max rank) that allows her to sustain a lot when burrowed or hit like a truck with Furious Bite when unburrowed
It's strong, but her tunnels usually do not stay around long enough for her to make use of it.
